info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 2 at 7:24AM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
At 723 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm near Rock Island, moving east at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Minor flooding.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding.
Locations impacted include... Silvis Heights, Moline, Rapids City, West Lake Park, Campbells Island, Taylor Ridge, Port Byron, Panorama Park, Davenport Municipal Airport, Riverdale, Osborn, Buffalo, Eldridge, Blackhawk State Park, East Moline, Colona, Barstow, Le Claire, Fruitland, and Oak Grove.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 286 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 20. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforcement.
If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed.

parameter.value: A thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rock Island, northwestern Henry and central Scott Counties through 900 AM CDT
